authors.affiliation: Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3he2e","text":"Ceres Nanotrap Microbiome A Particles are used to capture and concentrate important pathogens from samples. https://www.ceresnano.com/protocols Protocol APP-082 was used to concentrate and extract target pathogens, scaled up from 10 mL to 35 mL samples using Ceres Microbiome A particles and the MagMAX Wastewater Ultra Nucleic Acid Isolation Kit. Following discussions with Ceres scientists, Enhancement Reagent 3 is recommended as opposed to Enhancement Reagent 1. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":108,"length":35}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AE97703B766711EFA7CE0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.ceresnano.com/protocols"}}}}
keywords: wastewater concentration,ceres nanoparticles,nanotrap microbiome A particles

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rcj9","text":"Ceres A beads (10 ml):  £13.68 per sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csthf","text":"Nanotrap Buffer (100 ml): £0.85 per sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csk3d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lo0a","text":"Extra equipment required:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c58c4","text":"Heat block, horizontal shaker or 50 mL tube rotator, 50 mL tube magnetic rack, 1.5-2 mL tube magnetic rack, vortex, serological pipet, mini centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37son","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3gjfk","text":"Approximate time needed: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4rtk","text":"About 2 hours for concentration and extraction (may vary depending on number of samples). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cop80","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3l2j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"4259A321341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Nanotrap protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"es4re","text":"Based on the protocol APP-082 from Ceres Nanosciences. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

related_materials.name: MagMAX™ Wastewater Ultra Nucleic Acid Isolation Kit

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c6d0n","text":"Manual Ceres Nanotrap concentration using Nanotrap Microbiome A Particles for a 35 mL environmental sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":106}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4kr6p","text":"Invert the environmental water sample 5 times to mix. Then, let it sit for 45 seconds at room temperature. (No need to wait for samples to reach room temperature before processing). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1uvaa","text":"Agitate, then filter environmental water sample through a coffee filter to remove suspended solids. Transfer 35 mL of filtered sample into a clean 50 mL conical tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ehg87","text":"Add 100 µL of Nanotrap Enhancement Reagent 3 (ER3) to the sample, cap the tube, and then invert 2 times to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9rfe2","text":"Add 525 µL of Nanotrap Microbiome A Particles (Nanotrap particles) to the sample, cap the sample and then invert 2 times to mix the particles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4s3r0","text":"Incubate samples with Nanotrap particles at room temperature for 30 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"82qhm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6sb35","text":"Note: Invert every 5 minutes or use a rotator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":46}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hi3j","text":"Place the tube on a DynaMag-50 magnetic rack to separate the Nanotrap particles from the sample for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6rt1u","text":"Using a serological pipette, discard the supernatant carefully without disturbing the Nanotrap particle pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5n0i0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ffdf","text":"Note: Can use a P-1000 or P-200 pipette to remove any remaining supernatant from the sample (be careful to not lose any Nanotrap particles when removing supernatant).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":166}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ue5s","text":"Add 1 mL of Nanotrap Buffer 2 to the tube and re-suspend the Nanotrap particle pellet by pipetting on the walls of the conical tube, gently re-suspend until all Nanotrap particles have been completely collected.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6abvn","text":"Transfer the Nanotrap particle suspension to a new 2 mL microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ad1gj","text":"Place the 2 mL microcentrifuge tube on a DynaMag-2 magnetic rack to separate the Nanotrap particles from the sample for 2 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"362du","text":"Using a P-1000 pipette, discard the supernatant carefully without disturbing the Nanotrap particle pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5aaql","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eg3ku","text":"Note: If any small amount of liquid is still present, use a smaller pipette to remove all the supernatant from the bottom of the tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":135}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kj6t","text":"Add 500 µL of MagMAX‱ Microbiome Lysis Solution to Nanotrap particle pellet, pipette up and down until Nanotrap particles are resuspended completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":20,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B076C20D441B11EF9D1A0A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vd00","text":"Close the tube lid and incubate the samples on a heating block at 56°C for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2u4p3","text":"Place the 2 mL microcentrifuge tube on a DynaMag-2 magnetic rack to separate the Nanotrap particles from the sample for 2 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5k074","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btksi","text":"Note: May need to briefly centrifuge the tube (Mini Centrifuge at 2000 g for 2-5 seconds) to remove drops from inside the lid before magnetic separation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":153}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6ndn","text":"Transfer 400 µL of supernatant/lysate to a new 2 mL collection tube and discard the Nanotrap particles pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"90bgj","text":"Sample is now ready for Part 2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dujje","text":"Part 2: Nanotrap Microbiome A MagMAX Wastewater Extraction Procedure","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":68}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fmere","text":"Add 530 µL of MagMAX Binding Buffer to the sample/lysate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bpiuv","text":"Add 10 µL of MagMAX Proteinase K to the sample/lysate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"tgrl","text":"Add 20 µL of MagMAX Magnetic Beads to the sample/lysate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e3k6e","text":"Vortex to mix, then incubate at 65⁰C on a heat block for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4t05o","text":"Place the tube on a DynaMag-2 magnetic rack to separate the magnetic beads from the sample for 2 minutes, then discard the supernatant using a pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2idso","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"84sic","text":"Note: May need to briefly centrifuge the tube (Mini Centrifuge at 2000 g for 2-5 seconds) to remove drops from inside the lid before magnetic separation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":153}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"47t4u","text":"Add 1000 µL of MagMAX wash buffer to sample and re-suspend the magnetic beads using a pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6r2ab","text":"Place the tube on a DynaMag-2 magnetic rack to separate the magnetic beads from the sample for 2 minutes, then discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bdl32","text":"Add 1000 µL of 80% EtOH to sample and re-suspend the magnetic beads using a pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"n0im","text":"Place the tube on a DynaMag-2 magnetic rack to separate the magnetic beads from the sample for 2 minutes, then discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b63fo","text":"Add 500 µL of 80% EtOH to sample and re-suspend the magnetic beads using a pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ta6d","text":"Place the tube on a DynaMag-2 magnetic rack to separate the magnetic beads from the sample for 2 minutes, then discard the supernatant by using a pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d4lk2","text":"Centrifuge the tube (Mini Centrifuge at 2000 g for 30 seconds).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eq7me","text":"Place the tube on a DynaMag-2 magnetic rack, then remove excess 80% EtOH using a smaller pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3t6f1","text":"Add 100 µL of MagMAX Elution Solution to re-suspend the magnetic beads and then incubate at 65⁰C for 10 minutes on a heat block (close caps).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ad1n","text":"Place the tube in the DynaMag-2 magnetic rack to separate the magnetic beads from the sample for 2 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63ee0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnjjg","text":"Note: May need to briefly centrifuge the tube (Mini Centrifuge at 2000 g for 2-5 seconds) to remove drops/condensation from inside the lid before magnetic separation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":166}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e879c","text":"Transfer the supernatant to a new tube, the sample is ready for downstream analysis or can be stored at -80⁰C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2uvv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85ufq","text":"Note: Multiple freeze-thaw cycles may cause degradation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":56}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Ceres Nanoparticles Concentration and Extraction using MagMAX Wastewater kit
